com.gieseckedevrient.smartcard
Class Channel

java.lang.Object
  com.gieseckedevrient.smartcard.Channel

public class Channel
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a basic or logical Channel that can be used for an APDU transfer from a phone application to a Secure Element. The Channels are managed by a Session instance.

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes this Channel.
Consider: After closing this Channel it can't be used for communication any more.
 Session getSession()
          Returns a reference to the Session to which this Channel is assigned to.
 boolean isBasicChannel()
          Returns true if this channel is a basic channel.
 boolean isClosed()
          Returns true if this channel is closed.
 byte[] transmit(byte[] command)
          Transmits the specified command APDU and returns the response APDU.

Method Detail

close

public void close()
Closes this Channel.
Consider: After closing this Channel it can't be used for communication any more.

isClosed

public boolean isClosed()
Returns true if this channel is closed.

Returns:
true if this channel is closed. false if this channel is still valid.

isBasicChannel

public boolean isBasicChannel()
Returns true if this channel is a basic channel.

Returns:
true if this channel is a basic channel. false if this channel is a logical channel.

transmit

public byte[] transmit(byte[] command)
                throws java.io.IOException
Transmits the specified command APDU and returns the response APDU.
Consider: Low level drivers will derive a TPDU from this specified APDU before the transfer is performed.
Consider: The class byte in the defined APDU will be completely ignored.

Restrictions:
  • MANAGE channel commands are not allowed.
  • AID selection commands are not allowed.
  • APDU must contain a valid class byte according to ISO 7816.
    •
    Use the openChannel commands of Session for these operations.

    Parameters:
    command - the command APDU to be transmitted.
    Returns:
    the response APDU.
    Throws:
    java.lang.NullPointerException - if command is null.
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - if an internal error occurs.
    java.io.IOException - if command transmission failed or the command is not allowed.

    getSession

    public Session getSession()
    Returns a reference to the Session to which this Channel is assigned to.

    Returns:
    a reference to the corresponding Session
